description: Erection of a single-storey rear extension.
application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>All new external facing brickwork in respect of the new extension hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance, including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture.</p><p><br></p><p>

REASON:&nbsp; To preserve the character and appearance of the De Beauvoir Conservation Area.</p>

<p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;">Prior to the commencement of the
relevant part of the work, the applicant shall submit, and have approved in
writing by the Local Planning Authority, a detailed layout, cross sections
(scale 1:20), full specifications and a detailed management and maintenance
plan of the biodiverse roof with a minimum substrate depth of 80mm, not
including the vegetative mat.&nbsp;</span><br></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;">The development shall not be carried out
otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved and shall be fully
implemented before the development is first occupied.&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;">REASON: To ensure that appropriate surface water attenuation is provided for the development.</span></p>

<p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;">A scheme for the provision and implementation of flood
resilient and resistant construction details and measures for the site to protect against
surface water flood risk shall be submitted to and agreed, in writing with the
LPA in consultation with the LLFA prior to the construction of the
measures.&nbsp; </span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;">The scheme shall be carried out in its entirety before the
extension is occupied and constructed and completed in accordance with the
approved plans in line with current best practices.</span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;"><br></span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm;vertical-align:baseline"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Aptos, sans-serif;">REASON:&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Aptos, sans-serif; font-size: 10.5pt;">The site is shown to have a high risk of surface water flooding as
stated on the 'Long Term Flood Risk Map for England- GOV.UK'; and has an
increased potential for elevated groundwater.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:6.0pt;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:6.0pt;margin-left:
0cm"><span style="font-family:&quot;Aptos&quot;,sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-hansi-theme-font:minor-latin"><o:p></o:p></span></p>
